str2: A primary preposition denoting the channel of an act; through.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A blow, stripe, wound; an affliction, plague. From plesso; a stroke; by implication, a wound; figuratively, a calamity.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To have come, be present, have arrived. A primary verb; to arrive, i.e. Be present.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
One. (including the neuter Hen); a primary numeral; one.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
And, even, also, namely.
Mourning, sorrow, sadness, grief. Strengthened from the alternate of pascho; grief.
And, even, also, namely.
A famine, hunger. Probably from leipo; a scarcity of food.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To burn up, consume entirely. From kata and kaio; to burn down, i.e. Consume wholly.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Fire; the heat of the sun, lightning; fig: strife, trials; the eternal fire. A primary word; 'fire'.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.
Strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure. From ischus; forcible.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Properly, to distinguish, i.e. Decide; by implication, to try, condemn, punish.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Feminine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
